Pre-Game Insights: The Tigers will look for a series win on Sunday afternoon against the Oakland Athletics.
The A's have announced that right-hander J.T. Ginn (0-0, 4.30 ERA) will start the final game of the club's second-to-last homestand.
Left-hander Tyler Holton (5-1, 2.31 ERA) is a leading candidate to pitch first for the Tigers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The A's will move their home games to Sacramento next season in anticipation of calling Las Vegas home in 2028.
The A's are taking a long look at top prospect Jacob Wilson, who has three hits in his past two starts at shortstop.
Others: Tarik Skubal, a Detroit Tigers ace, has a special connection to the Oakland Athletics and their longtime home, the Coliseum.
